snippet: A possible change of location on such short notice raises questions about when and where the negotiations will resume on the disputed program.
abstract: Iran’s foreign minister raises new doubts about the resumption of international talks over its disputed nuclear program, saying the location may not be Turkey, as previously agreed, and suggests Iraq and China as possible alternate hosts; change of location on such short notice, especially for such a charged diplomatic negotiation, seems to represent a new complication.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Steven Lee Myers from Washington, Steven Erlanger from Paris, Alan Cowell from London, and Artin Afkhami from Boston.

lead_paragraph: A possible change of location on such short notice raises questions about when and where the negotiations will resume on the disputed program.

headline.seo: Iran Balks at Holding Nuclear Talks in Turkey
headline.main: Iran Balks at Holding Nuclear Talks in Turkey
headline.print_headline: Iran Balks At Holding Nuclear Talks In Turkey
